message.content:
cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.SI, cs.NI, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of broadcasting a parallel Gaussian source over an additive white Gaussian noise broadcast channel, which is a classic problem in information theory and communication engineering. The paper proposes a hybrid digital-analog coding strategy that combines several coding techniques, including source coding, channel coding, layered source coding, and superposition broadcast channel coding. These techniques are all related to information theory and signal processing, which are core topics in computer science. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.IT (Information Theory). 

The paper also deals with the problem of mean-squared error distortion, which is a common criterion in multimedia signal processing and compression. Therefore, cs.MM (Multimedia) is also a likely sub-category. 

The paper also involves side information, which is a key concept in many areas of computer science, including machine learning, data compression, and communication. Therefore, cs.SI (Signal Processing) and cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) are also likely sub-categories. 

Finally, the paper proposes a coding scheme that improves on the state-of-the-art for broadcasting a white Gaussian source over an additive white Gaussian noise broadcast channel with bandwidth mismatch. This is a specific problem in communication engineering, which is a subfield of computer science. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) is also a possible sub-category, as it includes topics related to communication and signal processing.
